jobDescription: Oversees the acquisition, analysis and dissemination of subject matter knowledge. Conducts high level business analysis involving complex business requirements and processes. Analyzes current processes and recommends process improvements. Provides technical and business knowledge to clients. Keeps abreast of technological and competitive developments. Conducts research on industry practices and standards and other benchmarking data. Develops position statements on complex subject matter questions. Minimum Job Specs: Bachelors Degree in technology, finance, business or equivalent, 8 years of related financial services experience, Extensive knowledge of business functions, Experience with project management methodology, Excellent analytical skills, Very strong relationship management skills, Strong writing and presentation skills  The candidate must have deep expertise in all functional capabilities of Oracle iProcurement. This includes approval hierarchy workflow, internal and external catalog set up, project and asset tag set up, GL code generation for Capex and Opex requisitions, supplier set up for PO issuance, multiple currency handling, iPro responsibilities such as PO Buyer and Project Reference, supplier stores, and requisition category designations.  The candidate must have superior communication skills to respond to user questions, IT configuration questions, and questions from leadership. The candidate must also have the ability to conduct Oracle iPro training sessions.
